His breakthrough came in 1978, when he was cast as Reverend Jim Ignatowski on the hit sitcom "Taxi." In the 1980s, Lloyd transitioned to film, appearing in a range of projects, including "Who Framed Roger Rabbit" and "Back to the Future." His iconic portrayal of Doc Brown in the "Back to the Future" trilogy cemented his status as a beloved Hollywood character actor.
